metadata.title: CVE-2023-52607 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:powerpc/mm: Fix null-pointer dereference in pgtable_cache_add kasprintf()returns a pointer to dynamically allocated memory which can be NULL uponfailure. Ensure the allocation was successful by checking the pointervalidity.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52607` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-181-generic - 5.4.0-181.201~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-181-lowlatency - 5.4.0-181.201~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1124-aws - 5.4.0-1124.134~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1129-azure - 5.4.0-1129.136~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1128-gcp - 5.4.0-1128.137~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1071-ibm - 5.4.0-1071.76~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1123-oracle - 5.4.0-1123.132~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-1108-raspi - 5.4.0-1108.120~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
